alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou National Forest (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 18 at 8:22AM PDT until July 19 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR HAINES 6 WITH EXISTING FIRE FOR THE FLAT FIRE... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. * AFFECTED AREA...In ORZ619...The Flat fire. * WIND...North winds 10 to 15 mph. * HUMIDITY...Min humidity 15-25 percent. * DETAILEDURL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: If you have not packed your evacuation kit yet, now is the time to do so. This includes items like important documents and essentials you cannot live without. Fill your vehicle`s fuel tank. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Plan now to avoid using equipment that could cause sparks during the period when critical weather conditions are possible. Visit weather.gov/medford/wildfire for links to fire restrictions in your area. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible during the valid watch time. These conditions could promote the rapid spread of wildfires which could become life- threatening. Check weather.gov/medford for forecast updates and a possible upgrade of the this watch to a Red Flag Warning.
